description: Warfarin + Aspirin: Significantly increased bleeding risk. Avoid combination unless specifically indicated.
Warfarin + Ibuprofen: Increased bleeding risk and GI hemorrhage. Use alternative pain relief.
Warfarin + Naproxen: NSAIDs increase anticoagulant effect and bleeding risk.
Warfarin + Simvastatin: Statins may enhance anticoagulant effect.
Warfarin + Metronidazole: Increased INR and bleeding risk.
Warfarin + Ciprofloxacin: Fluoroquinolones significantly increase anticoagulant effect.
Warfarin + Fluoxetine: SSRIs increase bleeding risk with anticoagulants.
Warfarin + Sertraline: SSRIs increase bleeding risk.
Warfarin + Acetaminophen: High doses may increase INR.
Warfarin + Phenytoin: Complex interaction affecting both drug levels.
Warfarin + Rivaroxaban: Contraindicated - dual anticoagulation increases bleeding risk dramatically.
Warfarin + Clopidogrel: Increased bleeding risk - use only when clearly indicated.
Warfarin + Omeprazole: May increase Warfarin levels.
Warfarin + Vitamin K: Antagonizes Warfarin effect.
Warfarin + Erythromycin: Increases Warfarin effect and INR.
Warfarin + St. John's Wort: Decreases Warfarin effectiveness significantly.
Warfarin + Cranberry: May increase INR and bleeding risk.
Aspirin + Clopidogrel: Dual antiplatelet therapy increases bleeding risk.
Aspirin + Ibuprofen: Ibuprofen may reduce cardioprotective effect of low-dose Aspirin.
Aspirin + Naproxen: Increased GI bleeding risk.
Aspirin + Rivaroxaban: Triple therapy dramatically increases bleeding.
Aspirin + Spironolactone: May reduce effectiveness of Spironolactone.
Aspirin + Lisinopril: May reduce ACE inhibitor effectiveness.
Clopidogrel + Omeprazole: PPIs reduce Clopidogrel activation - use alternative PPI.
Clopidogrel + Esomeprazole: Same interaction as Omeprazole.
Simvastatin + Amiodarone: High risk of rhabdomyolysis - max 20mg Simvastatin.
Simvastatin + Verapamil: Risk of myopathy - max 10mg Simvastatin.
Simvastatin + Diltiazem: Risk of myopathy - max 10mg Simvastatin.
Simvastatin + Grapefruit: Significantly increases statin levels and toxicity risk.
Simvastatin + Itraconazole: Contraindicated - severe rhabdomyolysis risk.
Simvastatin + Ketoconazole: Contraindicated - severe rhabdomyolysis risk.
Simvastatin + Cyclosporine: Contraindicated due to rhabdomyolysis.
Atorvastatin + Ketoconazole: Increased statin levels - rhabdomyolysis risk.
Rosuvastatin + Ketoconazole: Less interaction but monitor.
Atorvastatin + Warfarin: May increase anticoagulant effect.
Simvastatin + Gemfibrozil: Contraindicated - high myopathy risk.
Simvastatin + Niacin: Increased myopathy risk at high doses.
Lisinopril + Valsartan: Dual RAAS blockade increases renal failure risk.
Lisinopril + Potassium: Hyperkalemia risk - monitor closely.
Lisinopril + Ibuprofen: NSAIDs reduce ACE inhibitor effectiveness.
Lisinopril + Aliskiren: Triple blockade - contraindicated in diabetes.
Metoprolol + Verapamil: Severe bradycardia and heart block risk.
Metoprolol + Clonidine: Rebound hypertension if Clonidine stopped.
Metoprolol + Dipivefrin: Severe hypertension with eye drops in some patients.
Metoprolol + Fluoxetine: CYP2D6 inhibition increases Metoprolol levels.
Metoprolol + Paroxetine: CYP2D6 inhibition increases Metoprolol levels.
Amlodipine + Metoprolol: Additive hypotensive effects - monitor closely.
Amlodipine + Simvastatin: Max Simvastatin 20mg with Amlodipine.
Amlodipine + Atorvastatin: May increase statin exposure.
Verapamil + Digoxin: Significantly increases Digoxin levels.
Verapamil + Metoprolol: AV block and heart failure risk.
Metformin + Furosemide: Risk of lactic acidosis.
Metformin + Alcohol: Increased lactic acidosis risk.
Metformin + Iodine contrast: Hold Metformin before/after contrast.
Glipizide + Metoprolol: Beta blockers mask hypoglycemia symptoms.
Sitagliptin + Metformin: Generally safe combination but monitor.
Empagliflozin + Furosemide: Increased dehydration and hypotension.
Bupropion + Wellbutrin XL: Never combine formulations.
Amitriptyline + Fluoxetine: TCA toxicity - arrhythmia risk.
Amitriptyline + Tramadol: Seizure and serotonin toxicity.
Amitriptyline + Clonidine: May reduce Clonidine effect.
Alprazolam + Alcohol: Severe CNS and respiratory depression.
Midazolam + Ketoconazole: Profound sedation - reduce dose 75%.
Tramadol + Fluoxetine: Serotonin syndrome and seizures.
Tramadol + Alprazolam: Respiratory depression - FDA black box.
Tramadol + Amitriptyline: Seizure and serotonin risk.
Oxycodone + Alprazolam: FDA black box - deaths reported.
Hydrocodone + Alprazolam: FDA black box warning.
Methadone + Alcohol: QT prolongation and respiratory depression.
Omeprazole + Clopidogrel: Reduced Clopidogrel activation by 45%.
Pantoprazole + Clopidogrel: Less interaction than Omeprazole - preferred PPI.
Quetiapine + Lorazepam: Enhanced sedation and hypotension.
Olanzapine + Alcohol: Severe sedation and hypotension.
Olanzapine + Lorazepam: IM combination may cause death.
Lorazepam IM + Olanzapine IM: Risk of cardiorespiratory depression and death.
Valproic Acid + Warfarin: Increased bleeding risk.
Valproic Acid + Aspirin: Increased bleeding and valproate toxicity.
Valproic Acid + Carbamazepine: Complex interaction - both levels affected.
Valproic Acid + Phenytoin: Both levels affected.
Valproic Acid + Lorazepam: Increased Lorazepam levels.
Ciprofloxacin + Tizanidine: Massively increased Tizanidine levels - fatal.
Ciprofloxacin + Antacids: Take 2 hours apart - reduced absorption.
Ciprofloxacin + Iron: Chelation - take 2 hours apart.
Clarithromycin + Atorvastatin: Hold statin during treatment.
Ketoconazole + Atorvastatin: Hold statin - rhabdomyolysis risk.
Diphenhydramine + Tramadol: CNS and respiratory depression.
Levothyroxine + Iron: Take 4 hours apart - chelation.
Levothyroxine + Warfarin: May increase Warfarin effect.
Prednisone + Warfarin: May increase or decrease INR.
Prednisone + Insulin: Increased blood glucose - adjust insulin.
Prednisone + Aspirin: Increased GI bleeding risk.
Prednisone + Ibuprofen: Increased GI bleeding risk.
Prednisone + Ciprofloxacin: Increased tendon rupture risk.
Prednisone + Levofloxacin: Increased tendon rupture risk.
Sildenafil + Ketoconazole: Increased effect - reduce dose.
Cyclosporine + Atorvastatin: Use lowest statin dose.
Digoxin + Furosemide: Hypokalemia increases toxicity risk.
Digoxin + Potassium: Potassium deficiency increases toxicity.
Lithium + Ibuprofen: Significantly increased Lithium levels.
Lithium + Furosemide: Variable effect on Lithium.
Amiodarone + Metoprolol: Bradycardia and AV block.
Ibuprofen + Aspirin: Reduced cardioprotection of Aspirin.
Ibuprofen + Lisinopril: Reduced ACE inhibitor effect.
